law_text: Operators entering a rotary intersection shall yield the right-of-way to any vehicle already in the intersection.
preventive_tip: Traffic inside the rotary always has the right of way. Do not force entry.
rule_summary: Must yield to vehicles already within the rotary.

law_text: Every motor vehicle... shall be inspected once each year.
penalty: $50 fine, plus surcharges and potential insurance points
preventive_tip: Check your sticker month; inspections expire on the last day of the month.
rule_summary: Vehicles must display a valid annual inspection sticker.

law_text: No person shall run a motor vehicle at a rate of speed greater than is reasonable and proper...
preventive_tip: In 'thickly settled' districts (houses <200ft apart), limit is 30mph unless posted.
rule_summary: Speed must be reasonable; default 30mph in thickly settled areas.

violation: Unsafe speed for conditions (Basic Speed Law)
law_text: No person shall drive a vehicle upon a highway at a speed greater than is reasonable or prudent having due regard for weather, visibility, traffic, and surface conditions.
preventive_tip: Even if the limit is 65, slow down if it's raining or foggy.
rule_summary: Speed must be reasonable for current conditions, regardless of posted limit.

law_text: No person shall drive a vehicle on strictly preferential use lanes (carpool) unless that vehicle carries the requisite number of occupants.
preventive_tip: Check the diamond lane signs; hours and occupancy rules vary.
rule_summary: Solo drivers cannot use HOV lanes during active hours.

law_text: A person shall not drive a motor vehicle while holding and operating a handheld wireless telephone or an electronic wireless communications device.
penalty: $20 base fine (1st offense), but fees make it ~$160+
preventive_tip: Mount your phone on the dash; holding it is illegal even at stoplights.
rule_summary: Holding a phone while driving is prohibited.

law_text: Drivers must exercise due care to avoid colliding with an authorized emergency vehicle... by moving from the lane adjacent to the shoulder or slowing down.
preventive_tip: If you see flashing lights on the shoulder, move left or slow down immediately.
rule_summary: Must change lanes or slow down significantly for stopped emergency vehicles.

law_text: No person shall operate a motor vehicle while using any portable electronic device while such vehicle is in motion.
preventive_tip: NY is strict on points for texting (5 points). Do not touch the phone.
rule_summary: Strict prohibition on using devices for data/texting while moving.

law_text: The driver of a vehicle shall stop before reaching the school bus when... a red visual signal is in operation.
preventive_tip: Stop for red flashing bus lights from either direction (unless divided highway).
rule_summary: Illegal to pass a stopped school bus displaying red lights.

law_text: A speed in excess of the limits specified... is prima facie evidence that the speed is not reasonable and prudent.
preventive_tip: Speed limits are 'prima facie'—you can be ticketed for unsafe speed even below the limit.
rule_summary: Exceeding posted limits is evidence of unreasonable speed.

law_text: A person may not operate a motor vehicle in this state unless financial responsibility is established for that vehicle.
preventive_tip: Keep a digital or paper copy of current insurance in the car at all times.
rule_summary: Driving without valid liability insurance is prohibited.

violation: Use of Wireless Device in School Crossing Zone
law_text: An operator may not use a wireless communication device while operating a motor vehicle within a school crossing zone...
preventive_tip: Put the phone down completely when you see flashing school zone lights.
rule_summary: Strict ban on all wireless device use in active school zones.

violation: Unsafe speed for conditions (Basic Speed Law)
law_text: No person shall drive a vehicle upon a highway at a speed greater than is reasonable and prudent under the conditions and having regard to the actual and potential hazards then existing.
penalty: Varies by speed; Fine starts low (e.g., $129 for 6-9 over), increases with speed, plus court costs. Fines double in school/work zones. Points assessed for 15+ mph over.
preventive_tip: Slow down for rain, fog, heavy traffic, and poor road surface conditions, even if you are under the posted limit.
rule_summary: Speed must be reasonable and prudent for current conditions, not just the posted limit.

law_text: A person commits the offense of excessive speeding by operating a vehicle at: (1) 50 miles per hour or more over the posted speed limit, or (2) 100 miles per hour or more regardless of the posted speed zone.
penalty: Criminal offense (2nd-degree misdemeanor). 1st offense: Up to 30 days in jail, up to $500 fine, mandatory court appearance. Repeat offense: Up to 90 days in jail, up to $1,000 fine, license suspension.
preventive_tip: Do not operate a vehicle at extreme speeds. This is now a criminal act in Florida, not a civil traffic ticket.
rule_summary: Extreme speeding (50+ over or 100+ mph) is a criminal misdemeanor, not a civil infraction.

law_text: A vehicle may not be driven in an HOV lane if occupied by fewer than the number of occupants indicated by a traffic control device (usually two or more), unless the vehicle is a qualifying low-emission vehicle with a decal.
penalty: Moving violation, $60 base fine (plus court costs/fees). May carry 0 points (under $\S 316.0741$) or 3 points (if cited under $\S 316.074$ - violation of a traffic control device).
preventive_tip: Check the posted occupancy sign. Ensure you meet the minimum requirement or have a valid state-issued HOV decal for a qualifying vehicle.
rule_summary: Solo drivers generally cannot use HOV lanes during active hours unless they have a low-emission decal.

law_text: A person may not operate a motor vehicle while manually typing or entering multiple letters, numbers, or symbols into a wireless communications device for the purpose of nonvoice interpersonal communication (text, email, instant message).
penalty: 1st offense: Non-moving violation, $30 base fine (~$108 total), 0 points. 2nd+ offense (within 5 years): Moving violation, $60 base fine (~$158 total), 3 points.
preventive_tip: Use voice commands for texting and messages. The law prohibits *manually typing* multiple characters while driving. You can use your phone when stationary (e.g., at a stoplight).
rule_summary: Manually typing or entering text/data into a phone for communication while driving is a primary offense.

violation: Handheld Device Use in Restricted Zones
law_text: A person may not operate a motor vehicle while using a wireless communications device in a handheld manner in a designated school crossing, school zone, or active work zone area.
penalty: Moving violation, $60 base fine (plus court costs/fees), 3 points. (No initial warning period, citation issued on first offense).
preventive_tip: When entering a school zone or seeing construction workers in an active work zone, ensure your phone is mounted and all communication/navigation is hands-free.
rule_summary: Any handheld use of a wireless device (including calls) is illegal in school crossings, school zones, and active work zones.
